greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n contains (2i)!*(2j)!/(i!*j!*(i+j)!) for i+j=n, i=0..n.
comment: One of three infinite families of integral factorial ratio sequences of height 1 (see Bober, Theorem 1.2). The other two are A007318 and A046521. A related table is A182073. - _Peter Bala_, Apr 10 2012
reference: R. K. Guy and Cal Long, Email to N. J. A. Sloane, Feb 22, 2002

Larcombe, Peter J.; French, David R. On the integrality of the Catalan-Larcombe-French sequence 1,8,80,896,10816,.... Proceedings of the Thirty-second Southeastern International Conference on Combinatorics, Graph Theory and Computing (Baton Rouge, LA, 2001). Congr. Numer. 148 (2001), 65-91. MR1887375
Umberto Scarpis, Sui numeri primi e sui problemi dell'analisi indeterminata in Questioni riguardanti le matematiche elementari, Nicola Zanichelli Editore (1924-1927, third edition), page 11.
link: J. W. Bober, Factorial ratios, hypergeometric series, and a family of step functions, 2007, arXiv:0709.1977v1 [math.NT], J. London Math. Soc. (2) 79 (2009), 422-444.
B Buca, T Prosen, Connected correlations, fluctuations and current of magnetization in the steady state of boundary driven XXZ spin chains, arXiv preprint arXiv:1509.04911, 2015
Ira Gessel, Rational functions with nonnegative power series, (slides).
T. M. Richardson, The Reciprocal Pascal Matrix, arXiv preprint arXiv:1405.6315, 2014
T. M. Richardson, The Super Patalan Numbers, arXiv preprint arXiv:1410.5880, 2014
T. M. Richardson, The Super Patalan Numbers, J. Int. Seq. 18 (2015) # 15.3.3
Thomas M. Richardson, The three 'R's and Dual Riordan Arrays, arXiv:1609.01193 [math.CO], 2016.
R. Sprugnoli, Riordan array proofs of identities in Gould's book
formula: The square array defined by f := (a, b)->add(binomial(2*a, k)*binomial(2*b, a+b-k)*(-1)^(a+b-k), k=0..2*a); and read by antidiagonals gives a signed version. See Sprugnoli, 3.38.
T(n,0) = A000984(n), T(n,k) = 4*T(n-1,k-1) - T(n,k-1) for k = 1..n. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 10 2014
program: (MAGMA) [Factorial(2*i)*Factorial(2*(n-i))/(Factorial(i)*Factorial(n)*Factorial(n-i)): i in [0..n], n in [0..10]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Apr 27 2012
xref: Apart perhaps from signs, diagonals give A000984, A002420, A078718. A007318, A046521, A182073.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 23 2002
